title: Cane River Creole National Historical Park: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons        Live music is a long-standing cultural tradition along Cane River. NPS Photo   Â    Cane River Creole National Historical Park consists of Oakland Plantation and the outbuildings of Magnolia Plantation. Grounds of both sites are open from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.. daily, and self-guiding maps are available on-site. A guided tour of the Oakland Slave/Tenant Quarters are available at 12:30 p.m. daily. The Oakland Plantation main house tour is conducted by a ranger every day at 1:00 p.m. Depending on staff levels, more tours may be available. Magnolia grounds tour are by appointment only.  Please call us at 318 356-8441.
